Description: Fragment from near rim of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater. Inside glazed with reserved band. Outside, a satyr to the right; his head wreathed in ivy and his raised right arm remain; added white for the fillet and the ivy leaves.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 101 no. 351 pl. 75)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1024)
